definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: You have made two blunders in as many minutes.
sentences.chinese: 你在两分钟内就犯了两次大错。

sentences.english: I say, you all are making a big mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我说，你们全错了，一个大错。

sentences.english: However, repeated small mistakes make a big mistake.
sentences.chinese: 小错总也改不了就是大错。

sentences.english: Their superficiality and ignorance led to a great mistake.
sentences.chinese: 他们的鄙陋无知造成大错。

sentences.english: His great abilities might have prevented many a blunder at the Fuehrer's headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 他的非凡才能可能使元首大本营避免铸成许多大错。

sentences.english: I am afraid you have pulled a boner this time.
sentences.chinese: 你这一回恐怕是犯了一个愚不可及的大错。

sentences.english: Little lies turn into big lies.
sentences.chinese: 小谎言的慢慢积累也许就是弥天大错。

sentences.english: But was it, in fact, a hideous goof?
sentences.chinese: 但事实上这是否是个弥天大错？

sentences.english: You just committed the blunder to end all blunders.
sentences.chinese: 你正好犯了一个超过所有大错的最大错误。

sentences.english: I made a blunder, and I tell myself that I'll never make that mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 我犯了个大错，我告诉自己绝不会再重蹈覆辙。

sentences.english: They blundered when they tried to take a shortcut.
sentences.chinese: 他们企图走捷径时犯了大错。

sentences.english: Paula just told me you managed to make another lulu, Sam.
sentences.chinese: 宝拉刚对我说你又犯了一次大错，山姆。

sentences.english: Eventually led to a big mistake, and she seemed to win their hearts and a decision.
sentences.chinese: 最终酿成了大错，她似乎决定收心了。
我们的领导又犯了大错。

sentences.english: Now, a mistake, I deeply regret.
sentences.chinese: 如今，犯了大错，我深深懊悔不已。

definition: to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to err/to make a mistake/to do the wrong thing
to dispose of a matter/to be done with it
